[[Dublin North-West (Dáil Éireann constituency)|Dublin North-West]]

[[Dublin Bay South (Dáil Éireann constituency)|Dublin Bay South]] |leader_title3 = [[European Parliament]] |leader_name3 = [[Dublin (European Parliament constituency)|Dublin constituency]] |timezone = [[Western European Time|WET]] |utc_offset = 0 |timezone_DST = [[Irish Standard Time|IST]] |utc_offset_DST = +1 }} '''Dublin''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|d|ʌ|b|l|ᵻ|n}}, {{Irish place name|Baile Átha Cliath}} {{IPA-ga|blʲaːˈklʲiəh|}}) is the capital and largest city of [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]].{{cite web|url=http://www.geography.ie/geography/social/docs/dublin.pdf |title=The Growth and Development of Dublin |format=PDF |accessdate=30 December 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130330062241/http://www.irishtimes.com/business/sectors/technology/mexican-city-to-be-twinned-with-dublin-says-lord-mayor-1.1343005 |archivedate=30 March 2013 }}{{cite web|url=http://everything2.com/title/primate+city |title=Primate City Definition and Examples |accessdate=21 October 2009}} Dublin is in the province of [[Leinster]] on Ireland's east coast, at the mouth of the [[River Liffey]]. The city has an urban area population of 1,345,402.{{cite web|url=http://www.dubchamber.ie/policy/economic-profile-of-dublin|title=Dublin Region Facts - Dublin Chamber of Commerce|work=dubchamber.ie}} The population of the [[Greater Dublin Area]], {{As of|2016|lc=y}}, was 1,904,806 people. Founded as a [[Viking]] settlement, the [[Kings of Dublin|Kingdom of Dublin]] became Ireland's principal city following the [[Norman invasion of Ireland|Norman invasion]]. The city expanded rapidly from the 17th century and was briefly the second largest city in the [[British Empire]] before the [[Acts of Union 1800|Acts of Union]] in 1800. Following the [[partition of Ireland]] in 1922, Dublin became the capital of the [[Irish Free State]], later renamed Ireland. Dublin is administered by a [[Dublin City Council|City Council]]. The city is listed by the [[Globalization and World Cities Research Network]] (GaWC) as a [[global city]], with a ranking of "Alpha-", which places it amongst the top thirty cities in the world.{{cite web|url=http://www.zyen.com/GFCI/GFCI%208.pdf |title=Global Financial Centres Index 8 |format=PDF |accessdate=30 December 2010}}{{cite web|url=http://www.lboro.ac.uk/gawc/world2008t.html |title= The World According to GaWC 2008 |publisher=Globalization and World Cities Research Network: [[Loughborough University]] |accessdate=6 November 2009 |date=3 June 2009 }} It is a historical and contemporary centre for education, the arts, administration, economy and industry.
